greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of (d+d') over all unordered pairs (d,d') with d*d' = n.
comment: Paraphrasing the Jovovic formula: if n is not a square then a(n) = sigma(n), the sum of divisors of n, otherwise a(n) = sigma(n) + sqrt(n). - _Omar E. Pol_, Jun 23 2009
Row sums of A161901. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 06 2014
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: a(4)=9 because pairs of factors are 1*4 and 2*2 and 1+4+2+2=9. a(6)=12 because pairs of factors are 1*6 and 2*3 and 1+6+2+3=12.
mathematica: Table[Sum[(i^2 + n) (1 - Ceiling[n/i] + Floor[n/i])/i, {i, Floor[Sqrt[n]]}], {n, 100}] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jul 14 2014 *)
Array[If[IntegerQ@ #2, #3 + #2, #3] & @@ {#, Sqrt@ #, DivisorSigma[1, #]} &, 69] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 23 2017 *)
program: A060866(n) = (sigma(n)+A037213(n)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 23 2017, after Jan 25 2003 formula of _Vladeta Jovovic_
results.author: _Jason Earls_, May 04 2001
